meanings.definition: To make false and malicious statements about someone.
meanings.sent1: She calumnied her coworker by spreading lies about her work ethic.
meanings.sent2: The politician calumnied his opponent in an attempt to win the election.
meanings.sent3: The gossiping parrot calumnied the poor cat, claiming it stole the treats.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds calumnied the sunny day, predicting a storm ahead.
meanings.sent5: The jealous rival calumnied the talented singer, trying to ruin her reputation.

meanings.definition: To slander or defame someone's character.
meanings.sent1: He calumnied his former friend by spreading rumors about his personal life.
meanings.sent2: The tabloid magazine calumnied the celebrity, causing a public outcry.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel calumnied the wise owl, claiming it couldn't hoot properly.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the wall calumnied the beauty of the historic building.
meanings.sent5: The bitter ex-lover calumnied the kind-hearted teacher, trying to tarnish her image.
